ca86d9dd8e95ae429b6adfd8e83ae107 (02:01): dopp: zmd awesom?±y trashed to death a 64bit system with 1GB+ ram for me, it leaked all the memory during the night and somebody waked me up very early in the morning 'cause th server stopped working.
ca86d9dd8e95ae429b6adfd8e83ae107 (02:01): since then, I decided to boicot it ;P
5c64092b3c8204923a3e309e311ff199 (02:01): I've been running it successfully on a coupla dozen systems, running rug periodically via cron to apply updates.
5c64092b3c8204923a3e309e311ff199 (02:02): it hasn't crashed anything yet *shrug*

2df02513b1d88e78542a6a8a65beb11a (02:02): boot the install CD, select installation, when you see this screen: http://shots.osdir.com/slideshows/original.php?release=637&slide=5 select 'Other' then click 'repair installed system', then choose either automatic or expert tools and use the boot loader module to re-install grub
5c64092b3c8204923a3e309e311ff199 (02:02): i don't use it exclusively, though... for my home-rolled stuff I'm insane and use YUM :)

5c64092b3c8204923a3e309e311ff199 (02:19): Commander-Crowe: according to this it will work: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Accelerated_Graphics_Port

3904974c863a035fbd0381428a76d95c (02:19): just that it seem to run through a pcie bus or something
